sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.eclipse.ui

Class Workbenches

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.eclipse.ui.Workbenches

  • public final class Workbenches
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility methods pertaining to Eclipse workbench.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbench getWorkbench()
        Gets the workbench.
        Returns:
        the workbench or null if it has not been created yet

      • getActiveWindow

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindow getActiveWindow()
        Gets the currently active window.
        Returns:
        the active window or null if the workbench has not been created yet

      • getActiveWindow

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindow getActiveWindow(@Nullable
                                              org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbench workbench)
        Gets the currently active window.
        Parameters:
        workbench - the workbench, may be null
        Returns:
        the active window or null if the workbench is null or if called from a non-UI thread

      • getActivePage

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPage getActivePage()
        Gets the currently active page.
        Returns:
        the active page or null if there is no active window

      • getActivePage

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPage getActivePage(@Nullable
                                          org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindow window)
        Gets the currently active page.
        Parameters:
        window - the window, may be null
        Returns:
        the active page or null if the window is null or there is no active page

      • getActivePart

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart getActivePart()
        Gets the currently active part.
        Returns:
        the active part or null if there is no active page

      • getActivePart

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart getActivePart(@Nullable
                                          org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPage page)
        Gets the currently active part.
        Parameters:
        page - the page, may be null
        Returns:
        the active part or null if the page is null or there is no active part

      • waitForWorkbench

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbench waitForWorkbench()
        Waits for the workbench. This method blocks until there is an available workbench.
        See Also:
        getWorkbench()

      • waitForActiveWindow

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindow waitForActiveWindow()
        Waits for the currently active window. This method blocks until there is an active window.
        See Also:
        getActiveWindow()

      • waitForActiveWindow

        public static final org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindow waitForActiveWindow(org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbench workbench)
        Waits for the currently active window. This method blocks until there is an active window.
        Parameters:
        workbench - the workbench, can not be null
        See Also:
        getActiveWindow(IWorkbench)
